_header: This brevit book of sober quantity
_description: ?William of Tours, Friar, ‘The Contemplacioun of Synnaris’ — 1560 lines in eight-line stanzas

BLAru285.First Lines: This breuit Buke of sober quantiteOff Synnaris callit þe contemplacioun…
BLAru285.Last Lines: …Schaw well in werk & without questiounThow sall in hevin be our lawreat
BLAru285.Attributed Author: William of touris of þe ordour of þe frer minouris (f. 47v); Explicit este Libellus ex compilacione et translacione fratris William Touris Ordinis Minors (f. 84)
BLAru285.Attributed Title: HEir Begynnis þe contemplacioun of Synnaris compilit be frer William of touris of þe ordour of þe frer minouris (f. 47v); William Touris Ordinis Minors (f. 84)

                Harleian 6919.
Scottish Text Society

BLHar6919.First Lines:
This breuit buke of sobre quantiteOf synnaris callit þe
                    contemplacioun…
BLHar6919.Last Lines:
…Schaw will In werk and without questiounThow sall In hewin
                    for ewir be laureate

Asloan.First Lines:
THis brevit buke of sobir quantiteOff Synnaris callit þe
                    contemplacioun…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Schawe will in werk & without questiounThow sall in
                    hevyne for evir be laureat…
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir ffollowis The comtemplacioun of synnaris appliand for euerilk day of
                    þe oulk And first for monunday of þe blynd and blunder and vicious
                    wanyte of þis warld (f. 263); Heir endis þe buke of þe
                    contemplacioun of synnaris writtin be þe hand of Ihon asloan (f.
                    290)
Asloan.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Asloan Manuscript.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 14, 16. Edinburgh, London: Blackwood, 1923, 192: 2.187-241.
